title: Downstate Man Dies in Missaukee County Accidental Shooting
content:
A downstate man is dead after he was accidentally shot in Missaukee County.
Just after 6 p.m. on Monday, deputies were called to a cabin on Blue Road and South Jeffs Road in Butterfield Township where a man said he had shot a family member.
The Missaukee County sheriff says when they got to the scene, they found 74-year-old Gerald Burgeson shot in the head.
Investigators say Burgeson was riding a three wheeler at a cabin he and his cousin both owned.
That's when police say he crossed in front of a target being used by his cousin for shooting practice and was shot in the head.
He died instantly.
Both men are from downstate and were in the area at a cabin they use for hunting.
